intro: Lacinaria brachyphylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaf lacinaria, is a flowering plant native to the temperate regions of South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant has narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are arranged alternately along the stem. It produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Lacinaria brachyphylla is often found in moist, shaded environments like woodlands and stream banks.
